page.title: 02POPULATION
page.content:
consists of small bungalows in which sixty to eighty percent of inhabitants are of a pensionable age. This large elderly population inevitably causes a strain on the health and social services which will increasingly become a problem.
The plan for population growth in Frinton estimated that by 1981, 23000 people would be living in the Frinton/Walton area, an increase of 17000 since 1961. However this planned growth has not been as sizeable as was expected, with only 14,000 people in the area in 1981. This, however, is only natural population decline which could have been predicted. More than 800 Old Age Pensioners live alone in this area, and out of 5677 elderly people, 2129 are over 75.
